location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.2964 of 1856 from Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay, to the Resident in the Persian Gulf [Commander Felix Jones]

mods.abstract: The letter and its enclosure relate to the ill-treatment of British subjects at Muscat, and protection to be extended to them. The letter encloses an extract of paragraph 19 from despatch no.23 of 1857 (folio 153), dated 17 April 1857, stating surprise on the part of the Court of Directors that any orders should have been necessary in the matter.
